title: China-Taiwan tensions could grip 2024 election as top Musk, Buffett and Dalio sound alarms
description: Elon Musk, Warren Buffett, Ray Dalio and others have weighed in on the fraying U.S.-China relations and rising tensions over a possible invasion of Taiwan.

title: Five takeaways about the consumer from Walmart, other retailers after a big week of earnings
description: Walmart, Home Depot and Target offered up the latest clues about the health of the American consumer — and previewed what could be ahead for the economy.

title: Fed Chair Powell says rates may not have to rise as much as expected to curb inflation
description: Powell spoke Friday at a "Perspectives on Monetary Policy" panel in Washington, D.C.

title: Republicans walk out of debt ceiling talks, say White House isn't being 'reasonable'
description: Financial markets dipped on news of the debt ceiling talks stalling, after a week of purported progress.

title: Turkey's Erdogan touts 'special relationship' with Putin, stands by his refusal to impose sanctions
description: The powerful Turkish leader's closeness to Putin, despite its membership in NATO, has made many Western leaders and diplomats nervous.

title: Morgan Stanley CEO plans to step down within the year, sparking Wall Street succession race
description: Morgan Stanley's board has narrowed its CEO search to three "very strong" internal candidates to succeed Gorman, the chief said.

title: Watch Fed Chairman Jerome Powell speak live on monetary policy
description: The remarks come with markets suddenly divided on where the Fed goes from here.

title: VistaJet CEO defends company's financials as auditor raises liquidity, debt concerns
description: VistaJet's net losses totaled $436 million over the past four years, and its debt load more than doubled last year as the company's fleet size ballooned.

title: Fed may be forced to defy market expectations and hike more aggressively, economist says
description: The U.S. Federal Reserve may be forced to defy market expectations hike interest rates aggressively again later this year, according to Daniele Antonucci, chief economist at Quintet Private Bank.

title: Italy is planning a sovereign fund amid a new era of national interest
description: Italy's Minister of Enterprises Adolfo Urso announced Wednesday a public-private fund that looks at consolidating "national strategic supply chains."

title: G-7 leaders to announce more sanctions on Russia; Zelenskyy expected to fly to Japan
description: A senior U.S. administration official said the government plans to introduce steps to "economically isolate" Russia to weaken its ability to wage war.

title: Russia's military has adapted and is now a more formidable enemy for Ukraine, defense analysts say
description: Defense analysts say Russia has adapted its tactics during the war and say a more structured, coordinated and reactive armed force has emerged.

title: New Zealand's finance chief denies pandering to voters' cost-of-living concerns
description: The New Zealand government had to balance helping people cope with higher costs of living with limiting the inflationary impact of government expenditure.

title: Children's’ allowances are outpacing inflation in Britain — with kids now getting $8 a week
description: Pocket money rose by more than inflation in the UK in the last year, and kids found ways to boost their income on top of that, a new report says.

title: Erdogan's election lead leaves Turkey's opposition reeling and an economy on the brink
description: The result of the first round of Turkey's presidential election was a blow to the opposition, which wants to unseat President Erdogan after 20 years in power.

title: Toyota redesigns bestselling Tacoma pickup amid increased midsize competition
description: Toyota has commanded a roughly 40% share of the American midsize pickup truck segment since 2019 when Ford Motor and Jeep re-entered the market.

title: These airlines are back in the black — they're looking to China as the next bright spot
description: Three major airlines in Asia are back in the black, rebounding from their pandemic doldrums as global travel picks up.

title: Read the letter: Twitter accuses Microsoft of using its data in unauthorized ways
description: Twitter wrote a letter to Microsoft on Thursday, claiming the software company is using its data in unauthorized ways.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Time to exhale and breathe
description: The rally in markets Thursday was driven by bad things that did not happen — or at least appear less likely to happen — rather than good things that did.
